dialogue.text: (The room was tense and silent, everyone sat there wide-eyed)
What do you mean, Edith?
Please follow me, my lord.
Everyone, please retire in your rooms. Detective Wakefield, please follow me...
Yes, my lord.
(Edith, Blackwood, and Elias rush into Eleanor's room)
There she is, my lord...
(On the floor, lies the lifeless body of Lady Eleanor.)
ELEANOR...?! Who dared to do this to my beloved sister?!
(Blackwood stormed out of the room enraged, while Edith still stood by the door shaking from shock)
(This doesn't look like an accident, let's search for some clues)
Almond Scent... cyanide! This case is definitely no accident.
So, this is the library, huh
I believe this is Lady Eleanor's desk.
There is something slipped inside this book
A key? And what is this..., a name card? Maybe I can try to call the number
A business proposal? It seems like Lady Eleanor is working on a new business venture. Interesting.
What box is this? It's locked. I wonder if the key is around here somewhere
Are all these threatening letters addressed to Lady Eleanor? I need to find the murderer as soon as possible. The suspect must have had such a strong motive.
I can say all the books in the library are so many and quite complete
There's a telephone here. But who should I dial?
Hello?
Hello, is this Mr. Edmund?
Hmm, and who is this I am talking to?
I am Elias Wakefield, a--
Elias Wakefield? As in the infamous detective in town? What brings you to reach out to me?
I'm working on a case, it's regarding Lady Eleanor Blackwood. I found your name card on her desk. What do you know about her?
Ah, Lady Blackwood. Did she hire you as well?
No... she has been murdered.
Oh...
That's why I need all the information you have on her so I can solve her death, since I found a note written by you.
She had reported to me that someone has been continuously writing her death threats. But I haven't found the culprit. It appears I was too late
Have you gotten any clues so far?
Lord Blackwood, Lady Eleanor, and Lord Fairfax, they are working on a new business venture, something related to railways. Someone who knows about this wants to ruin their plan.
And how do you know that?

One of the death threats Eleanor had shown me said that this person loathed their upcoming business plan, and went into great detail. I believe this person is someone close to them because that death threat was written way before the masquerade party for the business was held.
Hmm, I see. Thank you for the information, Mr. Edmund.
My pleasure, good luck on this case, Detective!
It is you who served the tea for Lady Eleanor, isn't it?
Yes, Sir! But I swear to God, it isn't me! You have to believe me!
Calm down! When was the last time you saw Lady Eleanor?
Yesterday night, I saw her walk into the library after the party and spent some time there before returning to her chambers.
How is the investigation going so far, Sir?
I'm currently still working on it.
Um...
Do you have something to tell?
I do not know if this is important, Sir...
You know everything matters, and please if you have some clues that will be helpful.
During the party last night, Lady Eleanor seemed so... nervous.
Yes, I noticed as well. Do you know why?
I do not know much, Sir. She was fine before, yet after talking with some people she suddenly changed her behavior.
Do you know whom she talked with the whole night?
I don't know because everyone used a mask. I remember she talked with three people, each wearing a black, gold, and silver mask respectively.
Thank you for the information.
Her face looks pale, her lips black. What could've happened to her?
A note asking her to meet at the library... I should investigate the library.
Where shall I begin my investigation?
During the masquerade, only one guest wore a black mask — Lord Blackwood, the host himself.
Now... where could Lord Blackwood be? I need answers — and quickly.
(footsteps approaching...)
Detective, how goes the investigation? I won't rest until the one responsible for my sister's death is found. I assure you — they'll receive no mercy.
I need access to the guest list. One of the servants mentioned Lady Eleanor spoke with three individuals during the ball. You were the one in the black mask, correct?
Yes, that was me. As the host, I wore black. But I entrusted all the arrangements to Mr. Henshaw — he's the only one who would have the full guest list.
Understood. I'll find Mr. Henshaw. Thank you, Lord Blackwood.
Do whatever it takes, Detective. And be quick... I fear this won't be the last tragedy if the killer isn't unmasked soon.
